Remarks: daughter of machinist Frederick William Gillespie, She lost all her jewellery including a heart-shaped ruby, perhaps the inspiration for the "Heart of the Ocean" from the 1997 film Titanic

Name: Mason, Mr. Frank Archibald Robert

Name: Mason, Mr. Frank Archibald Robert
Remarks: super tough. his accounts suggest the exact three boats and his profession is on all boats. All boats still have space! Picked B at the end because it had space left and he was transferred which fits many people with the same background.

Name: Cardeza, Mrs. Charlotte Wardle
Remarks: one of the richest passengers, occupied one of the most expensive suits, daughter of textile entrepreneur Thomas Drake

Name: Harper, Mr. Henry Sleeper
Remarks: brought pikanese dog and manservant onto the lifeboat, family owned publishing firm Harper and Brothers

Name: Romaine, Mr. Charles Hallace
Remarks: 3 and 5 are likely, but he may most likely have been in the Smoking Room gambling at this time of night. boat 5 was closest to this area and his further accounts suggest it too, Romaine was known to use several aliases, including Harry Romine. For this voyage, he chose “Mr. C. Rolmane.”
